meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a sect or sects.
meanings.sent1: The community center hosted a sectarian event for members of the local religious group.
meanings.sent2: The church split due to sectarian disagreements over the interpretation of scripture.
meanings.sent3: The sectarian debate over the color of the new carpet in the mosque lasted for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe choices were so sectarian, always wearing the colors associated with her religious group.
meanings.sent5: The sectarian nature of the political discussion made it difficult to find common ground.

meanings.sent1: As a sectarian, he followed the teachings of his small religious group.
meanings.sent2: The sectarian attended the weekly meetings at the sect's place of worship.
meanings.sent3: The sectarian was known for always carrying a small book of sect prayers.
meanings.sent4: She was a dedicated sectarian, never missing a gathering of her religious community.
meanings.sent5: The sectarian was proud of the traditions and beliefs of their sect.

meanings.definition: A person who is intolerant of those holding different opinions.
meanings.sent1: The sectarian refused to listen to any ideas that contradicted their own beliefs.
meanings.sent2: He was labeled a sectarian for his unwillingness to consider alternative viewpoints.
meanings.sent3: The family dinner turned into a humorous debate when Uncle Joe played the role of the sectarian.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness in discussions earned her the nickname 'the sectarian' among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The workplace became tense due to the presence of a known sectarian who couldn't accept differing perspectives.
